metadata.title: CVE-2020-36129 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
AOM v2.0.1 was discovered to contain a stack buffer overflow via thecomponent src/aom_image.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

aom-tools - 3.3.0-1
libaom3 - 3.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: aom package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-1').
